title: Man Utd prepared to delay signing Moussa Dembele in January
text:
Manchester United are targeting a move for Moussa Dembele (Getty Images)

Manchester United are willing to hold off signing Lyon striker Moussa Dembele in the January transfer window, according to reports.

The departures of Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez in the summer have left United short in attack, while Anthony Martial’s injury has only made the situation worse in recent weeks.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has already admitted that he will be looking to sign a new striker in January.

And Lyon’s Demebele is on United’s shortlist ahead of the upcoming transfer window.

Lyon are demanding £71m for Dembele (Getty Images)

But according to the Mail on Sunday, United are prepared to hold off on signing Dembele because they do not want to meet Lyon’s £71 million asking price.

The report claims that United will not alter their plans in January because of their poor start to the campaign and will not make ‘knee-jerk’ signings depending on if a player becomes available.

Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas stood firm over Dembele’s future in the summer and refused to sell the 23-year-old following interest from United and Juventus.

Dembele joined Lyon from Celtic in a £19.7m deal in August last year and has scored 26 goals in 56 appearances for the French club.
